replies.bodyText:
I remember you told me that the "XOR" is not anymore supported. If the "XOR" is still supported and it is not deprecated, then all the items about converting "XOR" to "1" should be removed from the document.
The reason why I suggested to remove the "XOR" is that "XOR" means "1", as long as the conditions are 2 or more (I don't know what's going to happen if you have "XOR" and 1 or 0 conditions (logically, you should never have "XOR" with less than 2 conditions), but I assume it is still the same as having "1"). Therefore, the "XOR" value is completely useless, as you can use "1" instead of it. I also suppose not everyone knows what "XOR" means, especially since in English "or" is normally supposed to be exclusive ("You can have this or that for 1 pound" doesn't mean you can have both).
replies.author: Cernelius

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the response here. Yeah, I think removing the XOR mention for now is best until we can clarify it. Agree that it's a classic problem that the commonly used 'or' is not a logical or, and is actually a logical 'xor'.
I was trying to track down the '1' value that was mentioned here and noticed that we still had code to handle xor.
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText:
So, can you confirm that the "XOR" has never been removed, thus the information about the fact that the "XOR" needed to be changed to "1" has always been wrong.
If so, can we at least deprecate the "XOR" in favour of "1"?
replies.author: Cernelius

replies.bodyText:
XOR Is still there.
What would "1" mean as a condition type?
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: A numeral condition type means that exactly that number of conditions must be true (no more, no less). That is why having "1" is the same as having "XOR".
replies.author: Cernelius

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the clarification @Cernelius
For the purpose of this conversation, it seems like the XOR mention should be removed from this doc since as far as I can tell it has not been updated.
If we were to update it, it's probably a conversation to move to forums. IMO we could probably do even better than changing the value from condition type to condition count.
